result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth D. Hester

defendant.name: Hester, Kenneth D.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:37 AM cases 20CF48, 20CF1499, 21CF716, 21CF1098, 22CF349 called. Defendant Kenneth D. Hester appeared by phone.  Attorney George E. Miller appeared by video for Kenneth D. Hester.  Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
The defense advises that they have not had contact with their client since early May and advises he may be withdrawing from the case. 
Court orders defendant to speak with his attorney today or tomorrow. 
Court would like to schedule 20CF48 for trial to keep things moving. 
Motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists to be submitted before final status conference. 
A three day jury trial is scheduled for February 1st, 2nd, 3rd 2023 (in person). 
A final status conference is scheduled for Wednesday November 30, 2022 at 10:00 AM (via Zoom, one hour).
Telephone scheduling conference on September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Scheduling conference on August 23, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on August 23, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on August 23, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Order Approving Adjournment of Status Conference.
Per the Court: 07/26/2022 Status Conference is removed from the calendar. Attorney Miller shall contact the Branch 2 judicial assistant for rescheduling.
Dated 06/27/2022, Letter from Attorney George Miller to Court requesting rescheduling of Status Conference.
Status conference on July 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Cases 20CF48, 20CF1499, 21CF716, 21CF1098, 22CF349 are called at 4:29 PM) Defendant Kenneth Hester appears in person without counsel. ADA Robert Stoiber appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrant quashed. Court orders the previously ordered bonds remain in effect. 
Status Conference: July 26, 2022 at 9:30 AM (during intake).

(Cases 20CF48, 20CF1499, 21CF716, 21CF1098, 22CF349 are called at 4:05 PM) Defendant Kenneth D. Hester not in court.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for Kenneth D. Hester.  Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
No information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance. 
Warrant ordered. Court indicates if Defendant is picked up these cases will be set for trial, unless an agreement.
Status conference on June 23, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Cases called at 9:18 AM: 20CF48, 20CF1499, 21CF716, 21CF1098, 22CF349.
Defendant Kenneth D. Hester in court.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for Kenneth D. Hester.  Attorney Trenton Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Miller requests an adjournment and notes that he has not had contact with the Defendant since the last court date.
Court indicates that if there is no agreement at the next hearing the matter(s) will be set for trial.
STC: 6/23/22 at 4:00 PM.
Status conference on May 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.

11:05 AM cases 20CF48, 20CF1499, 21CF716, 21CF1098, 22CF349 called. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kenneth D. Hester not in court.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for Kenneth D. Hester. Defense tried to call the defendant before court with no success. State requests a warrant- so ordered in all files ($500 cash bond). Court notes age of files and states defendant will need to be in person to quash the warrants. 

11:10 AM all cases re called.  Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kenneth D. Hester in court.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for Kenneth D. Hester. Warrants are quashed. 
In all files: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court. Court orders 20 days for any motions. 
Defense requests a status conference. Court notes age of the files and states if there is not progress at the next hearing, one of the files should be put on the trial calendar. 
A status conference is scheduled for 5/12/22 at 9:15 AM in person.
